articles.author: Steve Holland, James Mackenzie
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden on Friday laid out what he described as a three-phase Israeli proposal for a ceasefire in Gaza in return for the release of Israeli hostages, saying "it's time for this war to end" and winning a positive initial reaction from Hamas.
articles.title: Biden unveils new Gaza truce proposal, Hamas responds positively

articles.author: Idrees Ali
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin tried to refocus attention on China's threat in the Pacific on Saturday, seeking to alleviate concerns that conflicts in Ukraine and Gaza have distracted from America's security commitments in Asia.
articles.title: U.S. defense chief refocuses attention on China security risks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India voted on Saturday in the final phase of a long-drawn general election, held in record summer heat in many parts, as both Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his challengers said they would win the polls centred mostly on inequality and religion.
articles.title: India votes in final phase of elections as both Modi and Rahul Gandhi eye victory

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Helen Coster, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Donald Trump said on Friday he would appeal the guilty verdict that made him the first U.S. president convicted of a crime, though he will have to wait until after his sentencing on July 11 before taking that step.
articles.title: Trump says he will appeal historic conviction

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Marian Robinson, mother of former U.S. first lady Michelle Obama, who provided support and stability, especially during the eight years of Barack Obama's presidency, died on Friday, the Obama and Robinson families said. She was 86.
articles.title: Marian Robinson, mother of Michelle Obama, dies at 86

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States is unlikely to help South Korea build nuclear-powered submarines at the moment, as it is stretched by AUKUS commitments to Australia, U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said at the Shangri-La security dialogue in Singapore.
articles.title: US doubtful it could help S. Korea on nuclear-powered subs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The vote share of South Africa's governing African National Congress (ANC) after this week's parliamentary election slipped further to just over 40% with results in from almost all polling stations, the electoral commission's website showed on Saturday.
articles.title: South Africa latest vote count puts ANC just over 40%

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Mexico's election is now the bloodiest in its modern history after a candidate running for local office in central Puebla state was murdered on Friday at a political rally, taking the number of assassinated candidates to 37 ahead of Sunday's vote.
articles.title: Mexican candidate assassinations hit grim record ahead of Sunday's election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli forces have ended combat operations in the Jabalia area of north Gaza after destroying more than 10 kilometres of tunnels during days of intense fighting that included over 200 air strikes, the military said on Friday.
articles.title: Israeli military says combat in part of north Gaza is over

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean defence minister Shin Won-sik said on Saturday that more evidence suggests weapons used by Russia in the war in Ukraine were illegally imported from North Korea.
articles.title: More evidence points to Russia-North Korea military cooperation, South Korea defence minister says
